channel.title: LollyScape Server Base [ADDING PICS]
channel.description:
I've decided to make a server base, as I'm disgusted at the quality of code in current private servers. I have created the base from scratch; not one part of it is taken from another source.
This server will include a User Interface, sporting an announcement feature and a player manager. Also, player saving now takes advantage Java's serialization technology. And there are not millions of variable declerations hogging up the Client class; all values and keys are now unified under 2 HashTables (one for Strings, and one for Integers, and I am adding one for Booleans).
Everything follows Java naming conventions e.g. hiMoparGuys() for methods, PENIS_SIZE for constants.
[b]Current progress:[/b]
[ul][li][s]Written core Server class[/s][/li] [li][s]Written Client Handler[/s][/li] [li][s]Written login code[/s][/li] [li][s]Written Ban Handler[/s][/li] [li]Currently writing the code to handle walking.[/li][/ul]
[s]There are no pictures as-of-yet, and I doubt there will be that many - after all, it's only a server base.[/s] I will be adding pictures, I am not at my development computer at the moment, but I will post pics.
[b]EDIT:[/b] I am going to gradually add images of my development progress, and when finished, I shall release the source to the public.
The Server GUI: (i know it looks like the one from kingscape, that's because I made the one in kingscape) [img]http://img218.imageshack.us/img218/9831/screen2d.png[/img]
The player manager: [img]http://img26.imageshack.us/img26/5813/screen3q.png[/img]
[b]More pictures coming soon.[/b]
Thanks, Ollie123.

There are no pictures as-of-yet, and I doubt there will be that many - after all, it’s only a server base.

[b]4) New topics:[/b] You must post at least a few pictures of your Development. If you do not, we cannot believe you. You may substitute this with a video. Why pictures/video? So you have proof you did something.

Everything follows Java naming conventions e.g. hiMoparGuys() for methods, PENIS_SIZE for constants.
